Posts.Content: ntvet wrote: Hi all, new here :).  Yesterday I found what I think to be a lump in the outer portion of the right breast/beginning armpit area.  I have pain here, sort of like stabbing needles, then it's dull for awhile.  I'm 25, and my great-grandmother died of BC when I was young; other than that, no other family history of BC. (*edit*: After some digging, I discovered my mom has cystic fibers) I have a Dr's appt scheduled for Dec 28...which is sort of a while off still.  The problem is that I'm currently finishing up a semester overseas, and get back to the States Dec 16.  With finals and everything coming up, I'm going out of my mind!  The only option I really have while still at school is to go to the campus nurse, who really won't be able to tell me anything.  What do I do??  How do I keep focus and not worry about this so much?  Thanks! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: uggh worried :( ntvet lookingaround

Posts.Content: Dec 7, 2011 11:38AM ntvet wrote: Thanks everyone for the warm welcome!  I finally was able to get a sooner appointment for Dec 16, the day I get back to the States.  Now I'm just trying to focus on finals and not worry too much.  I'll keep you updated, and wish me luck on finals! :)
Posts.Title: uggh worried :( ntvet lookingaround

Posts.Content: Dec 17, 2011 08:39PM ntvet wrote: Hi folks!  Had my appointment, and the Doc actually felt another lump in addition to the one I felt.  She sent me for an ultrasound, and I had that done the same day.  The tech said she didn't see any masses, and went to talk to the radiologist, but he didn't come talk to me.  Hoping that is a good thing!  The tech came back in and said that I will follow up with my Doc and 'decide what we would like to do clinically'.  I'm trying not to read too much into that, thinking maybe its just the standard line :).
Posts.Title: uggh worried :( ntvet lookingaround
